div.a: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 296 Greece?, date unknown Burial: after 120 B.C. (T); after 87 (Lewis) Contents: 48+ AR. Probably part of a hoard Athens: New Style tetradr. Disposition: Toronto Thompson, Athens (Ontario hd.), pp. 501-2, illus. Lewis, NC 1962, p. 281 Further information on this hd. or hds. has been received from John Wilkinson of Toronto. Apparently the coins were purchased from Baldwin's in two lots-one in 1928 and the other in 1930. We may be dealing with parts of two hds. and a connection of the 1930 lot with Halmyros (no. 289 above) is a possibility
